dlgLine.text: Lieutenant Adair came back this morning. He's asked for Paul to join his squad, citing an emergency article that drafts former officers back into service.
Adair is expecting Paul to be ready to go tomorrow morning.
I've got my own thoughts about this, but I'd like to hear what you think before I make a decision.

Obviously, losing a respected member of the shelter - especially one with combat experience - could weaken our effectiveness as a whole. On the other hand, if Paul were to work with Adair, perhaps we could get more cooperation from the military.
Paul's decision affects everyone here. Does anyone have a reason that Paul should stay or go?
Paul's been a valuable member of our group and he's saved more than a few lives when the bullets have started flying.

I'm not sure... We can't really afford to lose a valuable member of the team... As much as I'm sure the military could benefit from having him, it doesn't really leave us in a good position. And I have to favor the choice that's good for this group.
<To you> ...But it's up to you and Paul.
I'd prefer he stayed here.

This is a difficult decision for me... As a former soldier, despite how my career ended, there's a connection there that's hard to ignore. I can only imagine what they've been through, and I'm sure they could use me.
The people here mean a great deal to me. I've fought with them, I've represented them, and I've spent so much time getting to know them, that it's going to be so incredibly hard to leave them behind.
But... I feel like my place is back in the military, trying to make things better for everyone, not just the people here. It's hard to admit that, but it's the right thing to do.

However - I swear to you that I will work with Adair to prioritize the safety of the people here above all else. If he wants me, then he's going to have to agree to that condition. I will not let anything happen to this place and I will not forget any of you.
<To you> I've said what I had to... if you truly think I'm making a mistake, tell me now.
I've said what I had to.
I don't really have any love for Rainier. However, whatever my personal feelings, it doesn't change the fact that he's one of the only warm bodies here that knows how to shoot.
If we give them one of our members, what's next? Our medical personnel? Our mechanics? Do you see where that leads? Well, I do, and I say we chase them off now before this becomes a regular event.
<To you> ...If you've got any better ideas, I'm game.
We should have already wiped them out, but it looks like until we get our plan together, a show of force is what's needed here.
Didn't I say this would happen? Didn't I?
So this time, when they march their crewcuts up to the fence, I say we shave a few inches off the top. And if they still don't get the message, let's just take them out and be done with 'em.
<To you> I really hope you listen this time... but I'm with you if you got other plans.
We can't keep inviting them back - they need to know that messing with us is gonna cost them.
Hmm... it sounds like Paul's mind is made up. And if that's what he wants... he should go.
<To you> Unless you feel that's not a solution. I'll support whatever decision you make.
As he said, Paul may be able to aid us if he works with the military, so maybe it's in our best interest for him to go.

I'm all for supporting our military. But they're asking to take someone that's incredibly important to our community. Now, I understand sacrifice and honor, but what about the people here that will be a little less safe because he's not here to help out?
If it were anyone else, maybe, but I think Paul's more use to us here. Lieutenant Adair's already got plenty of soldiers - our group needs all the experienced survivors they can get.
<To you> If you really feel differently, I could be persuaded to go along with it.
I think we need to respectfully decline Adair's offer.
<To you> Well... what's your opinion on letting Paul go?

dlgAnsw.text: If Paul chooses to go, he should go. Hopefully, this will help us down the line.
Nobody takes our people! We have got to send a clear message that we will not tolerate the military's requests anymore.
I propose we give them 25 rations. I'll convince them we're giving them all we can spare.
We ate yesterday, so today we go without. We will resume normal rations tomorrow.
We have too many mouths to feed. Leave it to me... I'll take care of our problem the more direct way.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to keep Paul here. Is that the final say on the matter?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: Paul will leave our group and join up with Adair tomorrow. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to show a display of force in order to keep the military out of Splendid in the future. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to give them half of the requested supplies and convince them that we're complying as best as we can. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to cut food to the whole shelter for today in order to preserve more food for the future. It will be crucial that we find more food today. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: ...I'm not sure I agree with the implication of that decision. Are you sure that's how you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The final decision is to refuse Adair's request and keep Paul here.
I know how Paul feels about this, but we can't compromise our safety just because the military needs our help.
I know how Paul feels about this, but we can't compromise our safety just because the military needs our help.
If you really think it's for the best, I'll stay.

Respectfully, I have to disagree. I know this is a lot to ask, but I think we could use them as allies. I don't know how Adair's going to take this, but I'm sure it's not going to do us any favors if I stay here.
Well, at least you're not giving them what they want.

Saying 'no' is just inviting them to ask for something else later. We need to start seeing them for what they are - competition. And as we have come to realize, survival of the fittest is in full effect.
Ehh... I guess...
When are you going to learn? If you don't start seeing them as the enemy, then the next time they roll in here, they just might decide to take what they want.
Okay. I suppose many here would be upset if Paul left.
I would have liked more cooperation on our part, especially if Paul's influence could have made the military our ally.
I agree - this is for the best. Of course we should strive to help the military, but not if they're going to take one of our own.
I agree - this is for the best. Of course we should strive to help the military, but not if they're going to take one of our own.
VOID.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I'm not really on board with this... but I'll cash in one of my favors to you and go along with it.
That couldn't be farther from what I want. You want me to give up food for these people? I don't even know half their names.
Eat less? You know, I'll do it because I guess sometimes you don't make me regret coming here, but don't make this a regular thing.
You want ME to eat less?! What the hell kind of logic is that? We're in charge - if anything, it should be the other way around.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
I disagree, but... maybe you'll prove me wrong, I don't know.
It's a strong move... I like it. It sends the right message and buys good will in a way that nothing else will. Sure, we'll have to tighten our belts, but everyone will see us do it.
Paul will leave the shelter and join Adair's group.
If you think it'll help...
I'm not okay with this. I know what Paul said, but where are we going to find a replacement for him? This makes us weaker as a whole.

Than you for understanding. It's been my honor to serve the survivors here and I really needed to be a part of something bigger when you found me. But this is a higher calling and if it's in the military's power, than I need to help restore any kind of order I can to this madness.
I promise you all - I won't forget you, and I swear that I will repay your trust somehow... Please continue to look out for the people here, as I would.

Than you for understanding. It's been my honor to serve the survivors here and I really needed to be a part of something bigger when you found me. But this is a higher calling and if it's in the military's power, than I need to help restore any kind of order I can to this madness.
I promise you all - I won't forget you, and I swear that I will repay your trust somehow... Please continue to look out for the people here, as I would.
If that's how you want to handle this...
When they come asking for our medics and equipment, why don't you just go with them too.
Okay, well, I guess I get more say in things now, huh?
Dammit - why the hell are you giving them our people? Now they're never gonna stop!
We're doing the right thing. With Paul's help, perhaps we'll have one less enemy out in the world.
We're doing the right thing. With Paul's help, perhaps we'll have one less enemy out in the world.
If you two really think this is for the best...
Sure, that's great for the military, but where does that leave us? If they want to make this region more secure, why don't they start by sending some troops to protect us!
The decision is to offer Adair less, but reassure him that we're doing as much as we can to help.
I'm okay with this... I would rather we held on to that food, but who knows, maybe they can repay the favor one day.
I'm okay with this... I would rather we held on to that food, but who knows, maybe they can repay the favor one day.
I'm okay with giving them less, as long as they think we're cooperating.
I'm okay with giving them less, as long as they think we're cooperating.
If you think it's going to help, I suppose we can try it.
You're just encouraging them to come back and ask for more. We should be taking them down while they're weak.
I don't know... we can try it.
Those soldiers are just another group looking to take our shit. When the fuck are you going to learn?
I'd have given them what they asked for, but I do think our gesture will still be accepted.
I'd have given them what they asked for, but I do think our gesture will still be accepted.
Well, we're still helping them... And to be fair, you can be convincing when you want to be.
Well, we're still helping them... And to be fair, you can be convincing when you want to be.
The decision is to cut all food today, conserve resources for the future, and hopefully secure more food immediately.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
I'm really not happy about this, but I'll back you up because I have confidence you won't make this a weekly event.
No food today? And what happens if we're attacked or driven out of here? We'll be dead on our feet. <Shakes his head> You people...
Do I look like I diet? Still, I guess you've stuck your neck out for me before, so I can deal with it.
So let me get this straight - I don't eat and you'll probably make me do the heavy lifting out there? Well, why didn't you say we were having shit sandwiches for dinner?
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
The decision is to threaten Adair in order to keep the military out of Splendid.
I can understand your concerns... Guess we'll worry about the consequences later.
Great, another enemy, just what we need. I'm sure everyone's going to be thrilled to hear that.
I don't know why you're doing this... but I will try to do my part to reduce the blowback.
Adair just offered us an olive branch and you're trying to sharpen it and stick it in his eye. You're making a terrible call - not just for me, but for the safety of the people here.
Good - because it was only a matter of time before they came for medics and pilots, and I'd rather be dead than fly for a bunch of high school dropouts with guns.
Good - because it was only a matter of time before they came for medics and pilots, and I'd rather be dead than fly for a bunch of high school dropouts with guns.
Hell yeah. They want something from us, they better be ready to bleed for it.
Hell yeah. They want something from us, they better be ready to bleed for it.
I'm not sure what good this will do us, but I'll try to keep everyone's spirits high.
This is a pretty extreme response, don't you think? I don't think violence is necessary, especially since they seemed to be willing to work with us.
Well... I suppose they could be a threat...
You want to piss of the US military? Are you insane? We can't win that fight!
The decision has been made. That concludes our meeting.
